I’m proud to endorse Candace Valenzuela in #TX24. As the first Black woman and first Latina elected to her local school board, Candace has fought for everything she’s achieved.

Pitch in to help her flip this seat and bring the fight to Washington: https://secure.actblue.com/donate/cvctwitter?refcode=CoryBooker

RT @AFSCME .@SpeakerPelosi today joined AFSCME and called on the Senate to approve at least $1 trillion in flexible aid to states, cities and towns. “We are not worthy of praising our front-line heroes until we do everything possible to support them,” she said. https://www.afscme.org/blog/pelosi-joins-afscme-in-calling-for-state-local-aid-amid-soaring-virus-cases?utm_content=buffer358c1&utm_medium=social&utm_source=twitter.com&utm_campaign=buffer

We can start by passing the Justice in Policing Act.

Remdesivir costs less than $10 to manufacture. @GileadSciences is charging $3,100 for it.
 
Taxpayers spent $70 million to develop this drug. Coronavirus has killed 130,000 Americans. It's time to take control of this patent and provide remdesivir to all who need it. https://twitter.com/statnews/status/1278659943109976064 QT @statnews Opinion: U.S. government scientists helped invent remdesivir, and HHS has a legal and moral duty to ensure access to it in the U.S. and around the world. It has the policy tool it needs to do that. https://www.statnews.com/2020/07/02/powerful-law-gives-hhs-right-to-control-remdesivir-manufacturing-distribution?utm_content=buffer14d1d&utm_medium=social&utm_source=twitter&utm_campaign=twitter_organic

Donald Trump will spend this election trying to convince us that the economy isn’t collapsing. That everything is just fine. But he’s wrong—and his failed leadership got us here. @JoeBiden will use all of the tools of government to build our economy back better than before. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EclCeESXoAAzUcE.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1281628389284225026/vid/320x320/uABSeBji5MW-m5dp.mp4?tag=13

Americans want a health care system with more choices, lower premiums, and greater flexibility. 

Biden promises to deliver the exact opposite, doubling down on the failures of Obamacare with a one-size-fits-all, government-run health care system. https://lancasteronline.com/opinion/columnists/lancaster-gop-chairman-why-we-can-t-trust-biden-on-health-care-opinion/article_3b9125ac-c136-11ea-9ff2-43edf3440598.html?utm_medium=social&utm_source=twitter&utm_campaign=user-share

Had I been in Congress I would have voted for that action. https://www.kentuckynewera.com/opinion/article_186c7e71-ce4c-59e6-b69f-acc531594cf3.html

Auditor @NicoleRGalloway has spent her career taking on corrupt politicians and special interests—and winning. I am confident that as Governor of Missouri she'll do the same. I’m proud to join her in this fight. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Eck5LtGXsAAHqUH.png

We need people like @KateForCongress. She’ll put working families first and fight for a government that works for everyone. She's proven herself to be the transformational leader we need during uncertainty and crisis, and I look forward to the fresh leadership she'll bring to DC. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Eck4xbqWkAEs3aG.png

Representative @ErinForYall is a fighter who gets things done for working families. She has stood up for our environment, public education, and the rights of each and every Texan. I know she'll continue fighting the good fight when she's reelected. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Eck4P83WkAAYk3z.png

I'm proud to endorse @Tishaura for City Treasurer. She’s been laser focused on serving working families in St. Louis, and has been on the front lines of the fight to reduce the racial wealth gap. I know she'll continue her fight to improve the lives of the people she serves. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Eck30FnXoAYkCZ3.png

I’m proud to stand with @LydiaBeanTexas’s campaign for District 93 in the Texas House. Lydia has established herself as a strong leader and a voice for the voiceless in state politics. She's the right choice for this tremendous time of crisis. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Eck29dMWoAAVsWg.png

.@Brandon4Tenn has proven that he will fight for health care, criminal justice reform, and an economy that works for everyone—no exceptions. He'll bring historic representation to the Tennessee General Assembly, and I'm excited to stand with him. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Eck2gPQXkAA3Q0M.png

We've got a lot more work to do and we need @Bonnie4Congress's voice in that fight. I’m proud to call her a colleague. She’s doing tremendous work on behalf of our shared progressive values and the people she represents in New Jersey. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Eck16zQWoAAdFX6.png

Teachers get the job done. That's why I'm endorsing @PattiMinter4KY for reelection. She's been fighting for big, structural change her whole life—as an educator, an advocate, and a state representative leading the fight to protect health care, LGBTQ+ rights, and women veterans. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Eck1dICWoAMY1T2.png

As the son of immigrants and an educator, @RickyHurtadoNC brings the leadership and lived experience needed in this transformational moment. I know he’ll bring bold solutions to the table so working families can overcome this public health crisis and emerge stronger than before. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Eck1C2kWsAEe5F1.png

We need @CoryBooker's voice and vision more than ever. He’s helping lead the charge to end police brutality and root out systemic racism—and has forged coalitions to create progress for working families. I'm honored to endorse his campaign for reelection. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Eck0VP9WsAMO5KC.png

As a small business owner and breast cancer survivor, @SimaforTX knows no one should have to choose between a life-saving medication and feeding their family. She'll take on the drug lobby and protect Texans with pre-existing conditions. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EckzzmgXgAQv_Kg.png

It’s my privilege to endorse my friend and colleague @PramilaJayapal for reelection. She's a progressive champion we can depend on to fight corruption, stand up to racism and xenophobia, protect workers' rights, and expand environmental justice. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EckzU6IXoAE3ILZ.png

It’s an honor to endorse @HarrisonJaime’s campaign to bring new and bold leadership into the Senate. His empathy, character and integrity make him a leader South Carolinians deserve. I’m ready to fight with him to build a better future. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Ecky14yXgAUrSuw.png

I’m honored to stand with @TimsDesiree in the fight to flip OH-10. She understands the importance of a government that works for everyone, not just the wealthy and well-connected. She'll be a compassionate leader who will fight for quality jobs, education, and health care. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EckxlUsWAAAAo4H.png

Our country is in desperate need of bold leadership at every level. These candidates are stepping up for their communities and I'm proud to endorse them in these fights. Read more below, and if you’re able, chip in whatever you can to support them: https://secure.actblue.com/donate/ew-endorsements-social#?refcode=soc-FR-ew-tw-endorsements-4

I know your feelings were hurt that multiple Dem Presidents passed you over for SCOTUS, but you could try to show a modicum of class.

Larry, Trump has broken you. 

You used to be able to engage in principled debate—as you & I did in your ConLaw class.

Now, you’re a rich, bitter, angry Leftist. And you wouldn’t have directed that snide condescension at Kayleigh were she not a young, blonde woman. https://twitter.com/tribelaw/status/1281657595611283459 QT @tribelaw You embarrass me, @tedcruz — no “young female,” though you are my former student.
